verses.roman:
aho bhāgya, yamunāre pāiluṅ daraśana
eta bali' yamunāra karena stavana

synonyms: aho bhāgya—oh, My great fortune; yamunāre—of the river Yamunā; pāiluṅ—I have gotten; daraśana—vision; eta bali'-after saying this; yamunāra—of the river Yamunā; karena—does; stavana—praising.
translation: The Lord said, "Oh, what good fortune! Now I have seen the river Yamunā." Thus thinking the Ganges to be the river Yamunā, Caitanya Mahāprabhu began to offer prayers to it.
